meanings.definition: The quality or state of being visual.
meanings.sent1: Her visuality was evident in the way she painted colorful scenes.
meanings.sent2: The artist's visuality was showcased in the vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent3: His visuality was so strong that he could almost see sounds as colors.
meanings.sent4: The visuality of her imagination painted a vivid picture of the future.
meanings.sent5: The visuality of the sunset left a lasting impression on her mind.

meanings.definition: The ability to create mental images or pictures.
meanings.sent1: Children often have a strong visuality when reading fairy tales.
meanings.sent2: His visuality allowed him to vividly imagine faraway lands.
meanings.sent3: The visuality of his dreams sometimes felt more real than reality.
meanings.sent4: Her visuality was like a magic paintbrush, bringing stories to life.
meanings.sent5: The visuality of the book's descriptions made it hard to put down.

meanings.definition: The use of visual elements in communication or art.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement relied heavily on visuality to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: In graphic design, visuality plays a crucial role in conveying messages.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's visuality in his jokes added an extra layer of humor.
meanings.sent4: The visuality of the mural transformed the dull wall into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The visuality of the presentation made it engaging and easy to understand.
